content.description: Begins as a jug haul to the high first bolt. Survive some thin slab to reach the chicken heads and a good ledge at the anchor.
content.location: Two routes to the right of the prominent thin crack dihedral, Morning Beers, this route is next to the obvious black streak of The Stain.

content.description: A fun route when it isnt wet or mossy.
content.location: Between morning beers and "the twist"   Its is marked by the red 'stain' on the wall.

content.description: This is the possible looking, extremely hard, bolted arete seam
content.location: Directly left of Snap Dragon

content.description: Climb up the rainbow colored slab until you get the head wall. Take a breath before you break into an extremely difficult boulder problem with a one hand dyno to a sloper. It doesn’t end there, make sure you stay on your toes till you’re clipping the chains at the top.
content.location: Found on the slab directly to the right of the “Wizards Sleeve” project.

content.description: Climb up the pebbly pocketed face. Holds are pretty painful!
content.location: Climb the face to the right of 'Digital Direct' and to the left of 'Amoeba Brains'.

content.description: A beautiful sweeping dihedral crack on the dark bands of rock typical of the first Doors wall headed towards the N. Falls.   Cruiser with an exciting roof finish to the anchors!   If you see this is dry then climb it.
content.protection: small nuts to mid size cams
content.location: First Dihedral encountered along the Doors area while headed towards the N. Falls from the dog walk.

content.description: A few tough, thin reaches down low leads to excellent, thoughtful climbing above on positive flakes.
content.location: At the far left, climber's left, end of The Doors wall, this route climbs the vertical wall to climber's right of the arching wide crack, Ladie's Choice.

content.description: Arching wide crack just right of L.A. Woman.  Might be full of muck.
content.location: Just right of L.A. Woman, and left of Little Johnny Jewel

content.description: Lieback the crack to the good face holds on the right.  Top out straight up.
content.protection: Standard rack. Originally went mixed. The lone, manky bolt is now gone.
content.location: It's the 3rd "door" dihedral corner.

content.description: Cool looking lieback.
content.location: The 2nd "door" dihedral.

content.description: Step up the mossy slab to reach the first bolt. Pull the bluge and find a good stance to clip the 2nd bolt. High step and friction your way to the top.
content.location: Route is on the Wave Wall ~100ft past Fine Nine, just right of Lithuanian Chimney. Ascends the rounded, bulging arete.

content.description: Get out your dancing shoes for this trickster.  Good fun.
content.location: Just left of Beastie.  Goes through an offwidth at the top.

content.description: Wow this one is thin, so you better be on your crimp game! Begin by negotiating your way through thin holds, until they get slightly better. At the last bolt you'll run into what looks like a blank section covered in moss. Keep your eyes out for the mono, it's key to get to the anchors.
content.location: Located directly to the right of 'Cro-Magnon Warrior', and to the left of 'No Brains'.

content.description: Climb the shorter, dark colored face.
content.location: First sport route right of The Twist

content.description: Climb the face that bulges
content.location: Directly left of Cyber Sex. It is easy to find since Cyber Sex has large "eye bolts" that protect it.

content.description: This is the route close to the trail that is protected by "eye bolts". Climb through good holds and save some juice for the end.
content.location: Directly next to the trail. Look for the "eye bolts"

climbs.name: Cro-Magnon Warrior
climbs.fa: Eric Ulner, Tim Toula & Jim Thurmond 1986

content.description: Very obvious line in the middle of the wall.  Follow a seam using power liebacking.  The 1st sport route at the falls.  Mega classic.
content.location: Beautiful seam in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Climb the off width that is protected by bolts. Not as easy as it looks
content.location: Directly right of Fancy Feet

content.description: This ones hard the whole way!
content.location: To the right of 'Little Johnny Jewel' and to the left of 'Cro-Magnon Warrior'.

content.description: Diffucult bouldery start leads to more moderate climbing up the arete.  After 3rd bolt exit arete to right and finish on slab top-out.
content.location: The prominent arete directly across from Spleef Peak

content.description: Moderate climbing leads to a distinct crux, with a delicate slab to finish the route off.
content.location: On the wall to the left of the wall with 'Cro-Magnon Warrior'. The route starts on the right side in the deep red part of the wall. This is the only route on this wall.

content.description: The Doors is located 150 yards east of the north falls (if your looking at the falls east is to your right), adjacent to Spleef Peak. This area has about a dozen sport climbs from 11a to 14-, and a few descent trad lines. The doors is marked by 3 prominent dihedrals.
